variants.Description in input context: L166P mutation in DJ-1 is associated with early-onset Parkinson's disease (PD)
G93A mutation in DJ-1 is associated with PD
A53T mutation in DJ-1 is associated with familial PD

Material used.Material Name: Brain tissue from patients with L166P mutation
Material used.Description: IHC was performed on brain tissue from patients with the L166P mutation to assess DJ-1 protein localization.

Readout description.Result Description: DJ-1 protein was mislocalized to the cytoplasm in brain tissue expressing the L166P mutation.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed using brain tissue from independent patients.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type brain tissue was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Normal brain tissue without DJ-1 mutations was used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Description: Validation was performed using recombinant DJ-1 protein with the L166P mutation.

Thresholds.Normal readout: DJ-1 localized to nucleus in >80% of cells
Thresholds.Abnormal readout: DJ-1 mislocalized to cytoplasm in >50% of cells

Material used.Material Name: HEK293 cells expressing G93A mutant DJ-1
Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transiently transfected with plasmids encoding the G93A mutant DJ-1.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot showed a 40% reduction in DJ-1 protein levels in cells expressing the G93A mutation.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type HEK29细胞 were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Description: Validation was confirmed with siRNA knockdown of endogenous DJ-1.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were stably transfected with the A53T mutant DJ-1 plasmid.

Readout description.Result Description: Mitochondrial respiration rates were reduced by 30% in A53T-expressing cells compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent stable cell lines were generated.

Technical replicates.Description: Each measurement was repeated in quintuplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SH-SY5Y cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without DJ-1 overexpression were used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Description: Validation was confirmed using siRNA targeting DJ-1.

Material used.Description: DJ-1 knockout mice were tested in the rotarod and open field assays.

Readout description.Result Description: DJ-1 knockout mice exhibited impaired motor coordination (rotarod latency reduced by 40%) and decreased locomotor activity (open field distance reduced by 35%).

Biological replicates.Description: Six mice per group were tested.

Technical replicates.Description: Each mouse was tested three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type littermates were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No control was used for knockout mice.

Validation controls P/LP.Description: Validation was confirmed with rescue experiments using wild-type DJ-1.

Thresholds.Normal readout: Rotarod latency ≥ 120 seconds, open field distance ≥ 10 meters
Thresholds.Abnormal readout: Rotarod latency < 72 seconds, open field distance < 6 meters
